definitions: the quality of being easy to mold, cut, compress, or fold

examples.text: I snuggled deeper into the warm softness of my bed
the hardness of the steel contrasted with the softness of the wax

shortDefinitions: quality of being easy to mould, cut, or fold

definitions: the quality of having a smooth surface or texture; lack of roughness

examples.text: the velvet softness of the fur
I noticed an improvement in the softness of my hair and skin

shortDefinitions: quality of having smooth surface or texture

examples.text: his mother upbraided him for his softness

definitions: the tendency of a market, currency, or commodity to fall in value

examples.text: pressure on businesses due to continued softness in the global equity markets

shortDefinitions: tendency of market, currency, or commodity to fall in value

definitions: a subtle effect or contrast; lack of sharp definition

examples.text: the graininess and softness of the picture are the primary flaws

definitions: the quality of a sound being quiet and gentle

examples.text: the softness of her voice mesmerized him

shortDefinitions: quality of sound being quiet and gentle

definitions: the quality of being mild, gentle, or tender; lack of force

examples.text: the softness of her touch on his hands

shortDefinitions: quality of being mild, gentle, or tender

definitions: the quality of being sympathetic, lenient, or compassionate

examples.text: he recommended conciliation and softness towards national minorities

shortDefinitions: quality of being sympathetic, lenient, or compassionate

definitions: lack of harshness or anger in words or language; mildness

examples.text: the softness of the words were not lost on him

shortDefinitions: lack of harshness or anger in words or language

definitions: the degree to which water is free from mineral salts that make lathering difficult

examples.text: a glass-care program regulates the water softness

shortDefinitions: degree to which water is free from mineral salts that make lathering difficult
